Welcome to Organizing for Action: Follow @OFA for the latest news and updates on our efforts to help President Obama keep us moving forward.
“Let’s give families all across America the kind of security and certainty they deserve.”—President Obama urging Congress to take action
On middle class tax cuts: “I want you to call, I want you to send an email, post on their Facebook wall. If you tweet, use #My2K.”
Obama: “Make your voices heard over the next few days. Remind members of Congress to not get bogged down in a bunch of partisan bickering.”
“Let’s take the fear out for the vast majority of American families, so they don’t have to worry about $2,000 coming out of their pockets.”
President Obama: “I want the American people to urge Congress to begin the work we have by doing what we all agree on.”
“A clear majority of Americans agree with a balanced approach to deficit reduction and making sure that middle class taxes don’t go up.”
“The sooner Congress gets this done, the sooner our economy will get a boost.”—President Obama on extending middle class tax cuts
President Obama: “Right now, Congress can pass a law that would prevent a tax hike on the first $250,000 of everyone’s income.”
“If Congress does nothing, every family in America will see their taxes go up on January 1st.”—President Obama
President Obama: “We can solve these problems. But, where the clock is ticking right now is on middle class taxes.”
On tax cuts: “This is not some run-of-the-mill debate. We’ve got important decisions to make that are going to have a real impact."
“I want to give more Americans the chance to earn the skills that businesses are looking for right now.”—President Obama
President Obama: “I want to reward manufacturers like this one and small businesses that create jobs here in the United States.”
President Obama: “I believe we’re at our best when everybody has a chance to get ahead.”
“I believe America only thrives when we have a strong and growing middle class.”—President Obama
Obama: “I’ve been keeping my own naughty and nice list in Washington, so you should keep your eye on who gets K’NEX this year.”
“It is good to be right here at K’NEX.”—President Obama in Pennsylvania
We’ll be live-tweeting President Obama’s remarks in Hatfield, Pennsylvania.
If Congress acts now, most families could save $2,200 on their taxes. Share how that would help you using #My2k.
Tell Congress why it’s important to keep taxes low for millions of American families and small businesses with #My2K.
President Obama kept his promise to cut taxes for families—now, say why Congress should keep taxes low this year: http://t.co/lNVaFF72
“Let’s keep middle-class taxes low. That’s what our economy needs. That’s what the American people deserve.”—President Obama
Obama on extending tax cuts for American families: "I’m ready, willing, and excited to get this issue resolved in a bipartisan fashion.”
"Call your members of Congress, write them an email, post it on their Facebook walls. You can tweet it using the hashtag #my2k."
Obama: “If there’s one thing I’ve learned—when the American people speak loudly enough, lo and behold, Congress listens.”
President Obama on extending tax cuts: “I’ll sign this bill as soon as Congress sends it my way. I’ve got a pen. I’m ready to sign it.”
“If both parties agree we should not raise taxes on middle-class families, let’s begin our work on where we agree.”—President Obama
“A clear majority of Americans agree we should have a balanced approach to deficit reduction that doesn’t hurt middle-class families.”
President Obama: “Right now, Congress can pass a law that would prevent a tax hike on the first $250,000 of everybody’s income.”
“If Congress does nothing, every family in America will see their taxes go up in the beginning of next year.”—President Obama
President Obama: “Our ultimate goal is an agreement that gets our long-term deficit under control in a way that is fair and balanced.”
“This debate is not just about numbers—it’s a set of major decisions that are going to affect millions of families all across this country.”
President Obama: "There's been a lot of talk here in Washington about the deadlines we're facing on taxes and deficits."
We’ll be live-tweeting the President’s remarks on extending tax cuts for millions of families.
Signs in the air for Obama-Biden: http://t.co/HYVcdN1b
Nevadans: Your polls close at 7pm PT—and as long as you’re in line before then, you can vote. Spread the word and #StayInLine.
Pass it on, Iowa: Polls close at 9pm CT in the Hawkeye State. You can vote as long as you’re in line by then. #StayInLine
Live in Wisconsin or Minnesota? As long as you’re in line by 8pm CT, you can vote. Tell a friend—and #StayInLine.
RT if you’re in New Mexico or Colorado: Polls close at 7pm MT—and if you’re in line by then, you can vote. #StayInLine

“Tomorrow, let’s remind the world why America is the greatest nation on Earth. Let’s go vote. Let’s keep moving forward.”—President Obama
.@BarackObama: "I have just one question for you. Are you fired up? Are you ready to go?"
Obama: “One voice can change a room. And if it can change a room, it can change a city. And if it can change a city, it can change a state.”
Watch the story of "fired up, ready to go": http://t.co/ldT8LjXJ
"After a minute or so, I’m feeling kind of fired up. I’m feeling ready to go."—President Obama on the origin of the "fired up" chant in '08
"Everyone else shouts back, 'Ready to go!' So I turn, and there’s this small woman, about 60 years old, wearing a big church hat."
Obama: “Everybody else acts as though this is perfectly normal. And they all say ‘fired up!’ Then I hear this voice cry, ‘Ready to go!’”
The story of "fired up," from 2008: “I hear this voice cry out behind me: ‘Fired up!’ I’m startled. I don’t know what’s going on.”
.@BarackObama: “The single most powerful force in our democracy is you.”
Obama: “All of it depends on you bringing your friend, or neighbor, or coworker, mom, dad, wife, or husband to the polls with you tomorrow.”
President Obama: “It all comes down to one thing: you. It’s out of my hands now. It’s in yours.”
.@BarackObama: “We have come too far to let our hearts grow faint. Now is the time to keep pushing #forward.”
President Obama: "The autoworker who’s back on the job filled with the pride and dignity of building a great car—he needs a champion."
“The restaurant owner who needs a loan to expand after the bank turned him down—he needs a champion.”
President Obama: “The laid-off furniture worker who is retraining at age 55 for a career in biotechnology—she needs a champion.”
Obama: “The people who need a champion are the Americans whose letters I read late at night; the men & women I meet on the campaign trail.”
“If the price of peace in Washington is cutting deals that will kick students off financial aid … I won’t pay that price.”—President Obama
President Obama: "Their bet is on cynicism. But Iowa, you taught me to bet on you. You taught me to bet on hope."
President Obama: “I ran because your voices had been shut out of our democracy for far too long by special interests and politicians.”
"No one who fights for our freedom should have to fight for a job, or a roof over their head."—President Obama
.@BarackObama: "Change is turning the page on a decade of war so we can do some nation building here at home."
President Obama: "I don’t want a tax code that subsidizes oil company profits; I want to support the energy jobs of tomorrow." #Forward
“Change comes when we live up to this country’s legacy of innovation by investing in the next generation of technology and manufacturing.”
President Obama: "Change is a country where every American has a shot at a good education." #Forward
“You know that I’ll fight for you and your families every single day, as hard as I know how."—President Obama
President Obama: “You know what I believe. You know where I stand. You know I tell the truth.”
.@BarackObama: "Our fight goes on because this nation can’t succeed without a growing, thriving middle class." #Forward
“We’ve made real progress these past four years. But Iowa, we’re here tonight because we’ve got more work to do.”—President Obama
“Because of the service and sacrifice of our brave men and women in uniform, the war in Iraq is over. The war in Afghanistan is ending.”
President Obama: “No matter how tough the times are, we are all in this together—we rise or fall as one nation, as one people.”
"When the cynics said we couldn’t, you said 'Yes, we can.' And we did."—President Obama
President Obama: “To all of you who’ve lived and breathed the hard work of change:  Thank you. You took this campaign and made it your own.”
President Obama: “Your stories filled me with the resolve to fight for you every single day.”
“You welcomed me and Michelle into your homes; you picked us up when we needed a lift.”—President Obama in Des Moines, Iowa
President Obama: “I’ve come back to Iowa one more time to ask for your vote. I came back to ask you to help finish what we’ve started.”
POTUS: “Tomorrow, Iowa. Tomorrow, from the granite of New Hampshire to the Rockies of Colorado ... we will keep America moving forward.”
@MichelleObama: “While we have come so far, we know there is so much more to do. What we really, truly know is that we can’t turn back now.”
FLOTUS: “Tomorrow, we get the chance to finish what we started here in Iowa … we won’t stop until every vote & every last voice is counted.”
“Our family has been truly blessed by all of the love and support and prayers that we have received from every corner of this country.”
“For four years, Barack has been fighting to give every single one of us a fair shot at that American dream.”—First Lady @MichelleObama
FLOTUS: “He’s fought so women can get equal pay and students can afford college. He’s fought for seniors so they can retire with dignity.”
“I wanted a president driven not by politics or which way the wind was blowing, but by the struggles, hopes, and dreams of all Americans.”
.@MichelleObama on her fond Iowa memories: “Seeing my husband’s face carved in butter—believe me, we still talk about that at Christmas.”
“I love you from the bottom of my heart. I am beyond thrilled to be here with all of you.”—First Lady @MichelleObama in Iowa
We’ll be live-tweeting President Obama’s last campaign rally in Des Moines, Iowa.

Obama: “We’ve come too far to turn back now. We’ve come too far to let our hearts grow faint. Now’s the time to keep pushing forward.”
President Obama: "The future never has lobbyists like the status quo does, but the dreams of those children will be our saving grace."
"The people who need a champion are the men and women whose letters I read late at night."—President Obama
"The folks at the very top in Washington, they don’t need another champion in Washington. They'll always have a seat at the table."
Obama: "Their bet’s on cynicism. Ohio, my bet’s on you. My hope is with you. My fight is for you. And that is not a partisan statement."
Obama on special interests: “What they’re counting on now is you’re going to be so fed up, so worn down, you’ll just give up and walk away.”
“I’m not going to turn Medicare into a voucher just to pay for another millionaire’s tax cut. That’s not who we are.”—President Obama in OH
President Obama: "I’m proud we saved the American auto industry, but I’m prouder that we’re making even better cars than we used to."
"Don’t tell me if you can’t afford college, you should borrow money from your parents."—President Obama
President Obama: "Don’t tell me hiring teachers will not grow the economy—it will."
"You know I will fight for you and your family every single day, as hard as I know how.”—President Obama in Columbus, OH
POTUS: "I said we’d save an auto industry; we saved it. I do what I say. You know what I believe, where I stand. You know I tell the truth."
President Obama: "I said I’d end the war in Iraq; I ended it. I said I’d repeal ‘Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell’; I repealed it."
Obama: “When you’re making this choice, you have to remember that it’s not just about policy—it’s about choice. After 4 years, you know me.”
"Changing the facts when they’re inconvenient to your campaign—that’s not change."—President Obama in Ohio
President Obama on Romney: "Refusing to answer questions about the details of your policies until after the election, that isn’t change."
"We know what change looks like, and what he’s selling ain’t it. Giving more power to the biggest banks isn’t change."—Obama on Romney
President Obama on Romney: “He’s tried to repackage the old ideas that don’t work and offer them up as change.”
Obama: “Our market works best, our economy works best, when there are rules in place to prevent consumers from being taken advantage of.”
"America is stronger when everybody can count on affordable health insurance, and Medicare and Social Security in their golden years."
Obama: “Our economy works best when everybody’s participating—not just some. When everybody has a chance to get a great education.”
"Tomorrow, you've got a choice to make. Not just a choice between 2 candidates and 2 parties, but between 2 different visions for America."
President Obama: "Our fight goes on, because this nation cannot succeed without a growing, thriving middle class and paths of opportunity."
"We've made real progress, Ohio, but we've got more work to do. Our work is not yet done."—President Obama in Columbus
"Today, our businesses have created nearly 5.5 million jobs. The American auto industry has come roaring back. Home values are on the rise."
President Obama: "No matter how tough times may get, we're all in this together. We rise and fall as one nation and as one people."
President Obama on Jay Z and Bruce Springsteen: “Not only are they all on my iPod, but both of them tell an American story.”
“Hello, Columbus! Hello, Ohio! Are you fired up? Are you ready to go?”—President Obama
We’ll be live-tweeting the President’s remarks in Columbus, Ohio.

Obama in FL: "We’ve come too far to let our hearts grow faint. It’s time to keep moving forward to educate our kids, to create more jobs."
Obama: "The folks at the very top, they don’t need a champion. The people who need a champion are those whose letters I read every night."
Obama: "If the price of change is cutting deals with people who will cut students off financial aid, I’m not willing to pay that price."
President Obama: "I want all parties to work together. We’re not Democrats and Republicans first, we’re Americans first."
President Obama on Romney-Ryan and special interests: "Their bet is on your cynicism. But Florida, my bet is on you and your hope."
"Change is a future where we reduce our deficit in a way that’s balanced and responsible."—President Obama
President Obama: "As long as I’m commander in chief, we will pursue our enemies with the strongest military the world has ever known."
"Change is turning the page on a decade of war so we can do some nation building here at home."—President Obama in Florida
President Obama: "What I’m really proud of is not just that we’re building more cars in America, but that we’re building better cars.”
"The change I want to bring is to cut the growth in college tuition in half over the next ten years.”—President Obama
President Obama: "Don’t tell me that students who can’t afford college should just borrow money from their parents."
Obama: “I know what real change looks like—we’ve fought for it. I’ve got the scars to prove it; I’ve got the gray hairs to prove it.”
President Obama in Florida: "No matter what happens, I’ll fight for you and your families every single day, as hard as I know how.”
“You know I mean what I say and I say what I mean. I said I’d end the war in Iraq and I did. I said I’d reform health care, and I did.”
"Part of what you’re focused on is, how does somebody operate? After 4 years as President, you know me by now."—President Obama
President Obama in Florida: “Here’s the thing: When you make this choice, part of what you’re choosing is, who do you trust?”
President Obama on Romney: “Ruling out compromise by promising to rubber-stamp the tea party agenda in Congress: not change.”
“Giving more power back to the biggest banks, that’s not change. Another $5 trillion in tax cuts for the wealthiest—that’s not change.”
Obama on Romney: “In this campaign, he’s tried as hard as he can to repackage these old ideas that didn’t work and offer them up as change.”
Obama: "We don’t want politicians in Washington, most of whom are male, to make health care decisions that women can make for themselves."
President Obama: "We think America’s stronger when everybody can count on affordable, quality health insurance."
"Our economy grows best, the markets do best, when everybody has a chance to succeed. When everybody has a good education.”—President Obama
President Obama: "You can join me in building a future that focuses on a strong and growing middle class."
“This nation cannot succeed without a growing, thriving middle class. This nation does best when everybody has a fair shot." #AmericaForward
"As long as there is a child anywhere in the U.S. who is languishing in poverty, barred from opportunity, we know our fight must go on."
"Because of the sacrifice of our brave men and women in uniform, the war in Iraq is over. The war in Afghanistan is coming to a close."
President Obama: "Today, our businesses have created nearly 5 and a half million jobs."
President Obama in FL: "No matter how tough times are, we're all in this together. We rise and fall as one nation, as one people."
"Hello, Florida! Are you fired up? Are you ready to go?"—President Obama in Hollywood, FL
We’ll be live-tweeting the President’s remarks in Hollywood, Florida—follow along for the latest.

"I believe in you, Iowa, and I’m asking you to keep believing in me."—President Obama in Davenport
President Obama: "If you give me your vote, I promise you—you will have a President who hears your voices, who fights for your families."
President Obama in Iowa: "The American people are tougher than any tough times, because we pull together. We lift each other up."
"You can choose a foreign policy that’s reckless and wrong—or you can choose one that’s steady and strong."—President Obama
"You can choose the top-down policies that got us into this mess—or you can choose the policies that are getting us out of this mess."
"It's up to you young people here today to choose the future you want to see."—President Obama
President Obama: "Nobody who’s fought for America should have to fight for a job when they come home."
POTUS: "Finally, I will use the savings from ending the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan to put our people back to work here at home."
"Fourth, my plan will cut the deficit by $4 trillion over the next ten years in a balanced way. I will cut spending that we don’t need."
President Obama: "I want to work with colleges and universities to cut the growth of tuition in half over the next ten years."
"I will make it a national mission to educate our kids and train our workers better than anyone else in the world."—President Obama in Iowa
POTUS: "Today, there are factories in IA where once laid-off workers are back on the job building wind towers and wind blades."
"I want to cut our oil imports in half by 2020, so we control more of our own energy."—President Obama
"I want to end the tax breaks for companies that ship jobs overseas, and reward small business & manufacturers who create jobs right here."
President Obama: "My math actually adds up. Check it out at http://t.co/VYvwJFtG."
"I’ve got a plan that will actually create jobs, that will actually reduce the deficit, that will actually increase middle-class security."
"We’ve got to stick with the policies that are getting us out of this mess. And that’s why I’m running for a second term."—President Obama
President Obama: "We've come too far to turn back now. We can’t afford to go back to the same policies that got us into this mess."
"The unemployment rate has fallen to its lowest level since I took office. Home values and home sales are rising."—President Obama
"I bet on American workers and American ingenuity, and we saved a dying auto industry that's back on top of the world."—President Obama
President Obama: "I promised to end taxpayer-funded Wall Street bailouts for good—and we did."
